newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile Fachinal gold mine 96 output below target.
newsitem.headline: Chile Fachinal gold mine 96 output below target.

text.p: Chile's Fachinal gold mine expects to produce 30,000 ounces of gold this year, below its target of 44,000 ounces as the result of a slow start-up at the pit, said general manager Hector Araya.
"It is not as high as we expected as we suffered problems at the start of production," Araya told Reuters.
Fachinal, which lies in the far south near the town of Chile Chico, is owned by Idaho-based Coeur d'Alene Mines Corp.
Opened this year, the mine will produce 2.2 million ounces of silver compared with the company's target of around 2.5 million ounces, he said.

The mine, which has a minimum life of eight years, is unusual in that it lies in Chile's sparsely settled far south, an area largely unexplored for mining potential and thousands of miles from traditional mining areas in the Atacama Desert.
